title: Is Morgana a Darkin now???
body: Just played a game and our Urgot executed a Morgana with his ult and he said "I am all the weapon I need."  He only says that when executing an enemy Darkin plus Morgana heals from abilities much like Rhaast and Aatrox AND Varus did say hes looking for his SISTER. Rito pls dont get lazy and rework her into a Darkin just release a new champion its WAY cooler that way.{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Morg doesn't have a weapon. Darkin are living weapons, lol. So she cannot be darkin. 

Funny that happened though. Damn spaghetti code.

But what happens when the wielder bests the Darkin inside? Are they still bound to the weapon or can they just drop it while still retaining the Darkin's power?

Is SA Kayn still bound to the farming tool or is he just using it still cuz he's used to it?

Yeah. The darkin is the weapon and that's what has the power. If you cleanse the weapon of the darkin, I suppose the weapon would still have the power of the darkin, just not the soul of it. I assume that's why Kayn still uses the scythe. The Scythe has the power, but also the Darkin's influence.

The Darkin are *sealed* in the weapon aren't they? So removing the Darkin would remove the power of the weapon right?

Unless the Darkin is still "alive" but just like, subjugated permanently by whoever mastered it.

Actually, honestly? I highly doubt there's a way to kill Darkin. Otherwise, why would they need to be sealed away? You only seal things that you can't kill. So you're probably right. You're just... exerting dominance over the darkin. Kayn uses the weapon while being slowly corrupted by its influence. But, if he's strong enough with enough will, maybe he can just ignore Rhaast. All Rhaast can do is whisper stuff in Kayn's mind until he's ready to be taken over. 

So yea. The darkin is probably still alive. That makes sense lore wise too. I assume they want to do something with the 5 darkin, and they can't do that if Kayn killed one. So if anyone else picks up that scythe, they can still be corrupted. Kayn is just immune to it now

Unrelated but would you happen to know: is Aatrox actually still in the sword and the humanoid part just a corrupted version of whatever grabbed it that he's taking control of now?

Was always wondering why the sword was "alive".

It's possible Aatrox is the person and the sword together. Like, the corruption from the sword gradually spread until it fully covered its host. So it's just all one being now. I think it's more likely that yes, Aatrox is just the sword that can control the human because it's been fully corrupted. 

It's alive cuz the darkin, Aatrox, was sealed into the sword a long ass time ago. It isn't metabolically active so it's not technically "alive." It can't reproduce or anything like that. More like, it has thoughts and stuff cuz it's a soul.

I mean it's not like Riot isn't capable of doing different things here. The remaining Darkin (as far as we know) have all been sealed into weapons, but it's possible Varus' sister managed to escape that fate. Not to mention how Rhaast already had the 3 person quote for Varus LONG before his lore change came in.
The only surviving Darkin were the ones imprisoned into weapons. The rest killed or banished back to their alien home.
To further expand, the bridge to their alien home was utterly destroyed and sealed by an ancient queen. The odds of a Darkin in it's native form returning to Runeterra are astronomically low.
and they call that expectation subversion. When it happens dont call it a story masterpiece now.

It'd be a pretty wild trip is she turned out to be that way. I'd be a little upset honestly though unless her kit is changed. She doesn't feel all powerful like that. There'd be a major disconnect between the lore character and the game character.

It *does* seem a little early for her, but then again, we are supposed to get a champ roadmap near the end of April. Perhaps Morg and Kayle are on the list and they know enough that there will be a Darkin connection...

I know people are upset by the world "getting smaller," but Morg and Kayle need a new direction even if they weren't doing that. They were very much a part of the old "from a different dimension" backstory that the original lore had, and they *do* need a place in the new lore that actually connects to Runeterra somehow.

For an example where that worked in the past, just look at Taric. Previously, he had the same backstory as Morg/Kayle, essentially, as he was from a different dimension with gem magic. With the rework, he feels right at home with his new Demacia/Targon backstory. New and different =/= bad.

Ramifications on the Morgana's (and possibly Kayle's) roles and their abilities if they're basically re-created.

Since this is a speculation thread based off another character's VO, draws heavily upon lore to find proof that might justify the inconclusive, and with no real attempt to discuss game mechanics. I'd say yeah this thread fits a lot more with Story, Art & Sound.

I know they both very badly need a VGU (I am reminded of this every time I have to deal with Kayle's nonsense ult) but making them Darkin would be awful. Since there are only 2 Darkin left I would much rather they were new champions. Morgana doesn't even have a weapon!

At any rate I thought we already had a pretty good roadmap of the next few champs getting reworks and I didn't think they were on it.

I'm also pretty sure that's what they're planning to do with Morgana and Kayle, but I don't see how they could do that without redefining what Darkin are or at least broadening that definition quite a lot.

Whatever happens with the lore (I feel like there's no point caring whether it makes any sense when it's in such a constant state of flux anyway), I just hope this doesn't mean Morgana is going to be completely overhauled around a new weapon (seeing how she doesn't have one now, it's just her and her sorcery) and that she'll become such a completely different champion that she won't be Morgana anymore - we've already seen this happen to many other champions (albeit generally the more obscure ones).

But I can easily see how Riot (in their current state) would conclude that her black shield was "too much of a problem" ("Can you imagine if she were POPULAR?" à la Veigar) and that her trademark super-long root was just too "unfun" for opponents.

Morgana is going to be the next Darkin. And here is why...

CoffeeMug linked the concept art for {{champion:25}}  and she is holding a whip. Now I think what Riot is trying to do is the 4 Horsemen of the Apocalypse like many are saying and here is why. Let's use the game series Darksiders for a minute.

In Darksiders there are 4 Horsemen of the Apocalypse: War, Death, Strife, and Fury.
War is the embodiment of war itself and carries a massive greatsword. Who do we know that wields a big greatsword? {{champion:266}} . 
Death is the embodiment of, well, death. His signature weapon is a scythe that can break apart into smaller scythes. He is also the edgiest of the four and looks visually similar to {{champion:141}}  in a way. So this is Kayn/Rhaast.
Strife is someone that we have yet to see in the Darksiders universe, BUT in every concept art or picture of him we see him wielding two guns. Yes I am aware that two guns is Lucian BUT Riot instead went with {{champion:110}}  to be the ranged champion of the Darkin.

Now we get to Fury. She is the horseman(horsewoman?) to be the one with a WHIP and the only female of the four. Since Morgana's concept was supposed to have a whip this is where I say that she is going to be the next Darkin. I will probably get ripped a new one for saying "she is going to be one because she looks the same" but it is definitely the only possibility that could fit here. She fits the Darkin look as well.

Also, with the Aatrox rework that has just come out you can take a look at SkinSpotlights (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0NwzCHb8Fg89eTB5eYX17Q) who has the Special Interactions for Aatrox https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Pn41Ecefm4&t=786s)                                              and his voice lines towards her are very convincing. If you do not believe me then check it out for yourselves. That is why I linked them. 4:16 & 10:01 in the video
